resources.string: The device does not have required services.
Web Browser application is not available.

Since Android 6.0 Marshmallow system requires granting access to device\'s location in order to scan for Bluetooth Smart devices. Bluetooth beacons may be used to determine the phone\'s and user\'s location.

nRF Toolbox would like to copy some sample applications, that may be uploaded onto your nRF51 device using the DFU (Device Firmware Update), to the memory of this device. If you agree, you will be asked to give the application permission to access files on your device.
The nRF Toolbox is a container application that stores your Nordic Semiconductor apps in one location.
Shows a notification when a device is connected in background.
Shows notifications when new files has been saved.
Shows notifications when a proximity device got out of range.
Device type number (the actual device type can be resolved with a look-up table).
Hardware descriptor string (friendly name of this device).
Upper word of the microcontroller\'s unique identifier.
Lower word of the microcontroller\'s unique identifier.
Unique identifier of the hardware (a.k.a. serial number).
LoLaN ID of the device. \nDefault: 32767 or the serial number modulo 10000 (last four digits in decimal)
Interval between the UWB beacon packets in active mode in milliseconds. \nMinimum value: 100 \nDefault: 1000

The rate of accelerometer data informing in active mode depends on this setting. If the value of this variable is n, every n-th packet will contain acceleration data. Set to zero to disable this feature, set to 1 to make every single packet contain acceleration data. \nDefault: 0
Time-out of the active mode (computed from the last detected movement) in milliseconds. \nMinimum value: 1000. \nDefault: 10000
Interval between packets containing information about this device. \nMinimum value: 1000. \nDefault: 30000

The minimum acceleration to leave quiescent mode (14-bit raw value, LSB = 0,244 mg). If the acceleration reaches this limit, transition to active mode occurs (in quiescent mode) or the device stays in active mode (in active mode). Mind the maximum resolution of the accelerometer IC and the high resolution mode when setting this parameter! \nDefault: 128

Averaging time for the rest (quiescence) detection in milliseconds: quiescence can be detected with this delay. Minimum and maximum possible value depends on accelerometer data rate settings. \nRecommended range: 500..2000 \nDefault: 2000

Switch of the high resolution accelerometer mode (logical value). Non-zero value enables high resolution mode, which fully exploits the accelerometer\'s possibilities resulting in 10, 12 or 14-bit acceleration values (depending on the hardware) and more power consumption. If set to zero, only 8-bit values will be obtained with less consumed power. \nDefault: 0

Acceleration data collector mode setting. If this feature is enabled, acceleration data with relative timestamps will be accumulated in TSD format in acc_data_tsd variable. When the accumulator buffer becomes fills up (it can contain 10 acceleration vector with timestamp) it will be INFORMed. 
Valid options: 
 0 = disabled 
 1 = 1.25 Hz mode 
 6 = 6.25 Hz mode 
 12 = 12.5 Hz mode 
 50 = 50 Hz mode 
 100 = 100 Hz mode 
 Default: 0

Acceleration data collector mode always on setting. Set non-zero to make accelerometer data collection run continuously in active and also quiescent mode. Otherwise (on zero) it will run only in active mode. \nDefault: 0

Delay of the movement after quiescent mode indicator packets in milliseconds. Minimum and maximum possible value depends on accelerometer data rate settings. \nRecommended range: 500..1000 \nDefault: 500
A 4-bit number, which is the part of the BLE advertising packet. It can be used for various purposes. \nValid values: 0..15 \nDefault: 0
UWB packet preamble length. Valid options: 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096. \nDefault: 1024
Bit rate of UWB communication (in kbps). \nValid options: 110, 850, 6800. \nDefault: 110
Pulse repetition frequency of UWB communication (in MHz). Valid options: 4, 16, 64. \nDefault: 16
Transmission power for the UWB PHY header. Valid range: 0..67 (bigger value means bigger Tx power). \nDefault: 67
Transmission power for the synchronization header (SHR) and data. Valid range: 0..67 (bigger value means bigger Tx power). \nDefault: 67

Start of Frame Delimiter (SFD) setting. 
0 = standard 
1 = Decawave proprietary 
Default: 0
Write non-zero value to this variable to reset the device.
Write non-zero value to this variable to save settings to the flash memory.
Write non-zero value to this variable to reset the stored settings in the flash memory.

The actual state of the device. 
1 = normal operation 
2 = charging (ProTag only) 
3 = pre-shutdown state, battery is exhausted (ProTag only) 
4 = movement detected after quiescence (technical) 
5 = quiescence detected after movement (technical)
ProTag: battery charge percentage level, uint8 type. \nDuraTag: battery voltage level in millivolts, uint16 type.
Logical value, non-zero if charge is completed. \n(Has no meaning if not charging, also no meaning in DuraTags.)
The last acceleration value, x-axis component.
The last acceleration value, y-axis component.
The last acceleration value, z-axis component.
Bit depth of the acceleration values. If this value is b, the full dynamic range will be -2^(b-1) … 2^(b-1)-1 which corresponds to an acceleration range of +/-2g.
TSD format acceleration data collection. \n See FPTSD.PDF for mode information.
The temperature in Celsius degrees measured by the built-in temperature sensor of the pressure meter device. Always zero if no pressure meter present.
The air pressure in pascals measured by the pressure meter device. Always zero if no pressure meter present.
Counts the UWB beacon packets has been transmitted since the last charging was ended.

Number of suspicious acceleration value events. The FXOS8700 series accelerometer might fail in a particular manner (damaged on PCB assembly?) then it produces maximum acceleration values on some axis in a row (ever for minutes). The accelerometer fail check module tries to count these events and increments this variable. So this should be near zero, otherwise it may indicate accelerometer chip defect.

Accelerometer vector magnitude detection mode for movement detection to reduce power consumption. \n0 = VECM is disabled because acceleration data need to be reported - DRDY used instead \n1 = VECM is enabled
Auth0 client ID and Auth0 domain credentials are undefined.
